title: Testing Sites Locally
description: It's always a good idea to verify changes locally before pushing them to GitHub. This avoids potentially breaking a site, or having to a push simply to visualize your work (only to realize a minor typo and then stage-commit-push a second time). To do this you need to run Jekyll locally on your computer and then point your browser at your localhost. Unfortunately Jekyll is coded in Ruby which can be tricky to install on Windows.
